channel.title: Trailer Changelog
channel.description: Most recent changes with links to updates.

item.title: Version 1.0.22
item.description:
• Fetching statuses is now done for all, not just updated PRs. This means that status items will not be updated property but each refresh may eat up a lot of API allowance, so it now happens once every 10 refreshes by default (configurable via preferences)
  • Trailer will no longer fetch orgs or list the user's repos, but will base all processed repos on the user's watch list, which allows far greater flexibility on what they can select in the Repos list.
  • Postprocessing PRs after a sync happens only to new or updated PRs for improved performance.
  • Added indexes to speed up various DB lookup operations.
  • Menu icon should be stronger and less fuzzy in the menubar, especially on non-retina displays.

item.title: Version 1.0.21
item.description:
• Will additionally retrieve/auto-subscribe/etc the repositories that a user watches (but will skip repositories that are watched but the user has no permissions for - GitHub doesn’t clean those up)
  • Automatic update check improvements (Can be deactivated from preferences or check interval can be set in hours)

item.title: Version 1.0.20
item.description:
• Pressing Cmd-C over a highlighted item will copy its URL to the clipboard
  • You can drag a PR off the Trailer menu to paste its URL into another app
  • Keyboard shortcuts for Copy, Paste, Select-All, and Undo/Redo should now work on all text and search fields

item.title: Version 1.0.19
item.description:
• Corrected an issue where the PR merging / closing logic would not follow the settings in preferences
  • Corrected an issue where unread badge counts did not appear on some PR items

item.title: Version 1.0.17
item.description:
• Corrected an issue which would prefer “participated” over “mine” sections for references made on own PRs
  • Button in repository list preferences renamed to “load repositories” instead of “projects” to be clearer
  • Further database and sync performance improvements

item.title: Version 1.0.16
item.description:
• Improved counts on the menubar depending on the user's preferences
  • Corrected issue where the menubar icon may be red but no unread comments are listed
  • Built from the same tree as PocketTrailer 1.0.16 (just submitted for review)
  • From 1.0.15:
  • Preferences improvements in History section for handling merged and/or closed PRs
  • Trailer will now report any PRs in the “closed” section that get re-opened
  • New option to display number of listed PRs instead of all open PRs
  • Fix for un-mergeable PR status handling
  • Added Ctrl key support to keyboard shortcut and improved Keyboard section appearance
  • Small performance improvements

item.title: Version 1.0.14
item.description:
• Option to auto-subscribe to new repositories
  • Option-click opens items in background without closing the menu
  • Improvements and cleanups to keyboard navigation
  • More preferences tidying
  • Various fixes and optimizations

item.title: Version 1.0.13
item.description:
• Important fix for PR refreshing, as well as the changes from 1.0.12:
  • Mac OS X 10.8 support
  • Assigned PRs support
  • Option to limit un-mergeable warnings to own/participated PRs
  • Appearance and layout corrections in the menu
  • Status item appearance and cursor improvements
  • Keyboard shortcut and navigation
  • Bugfixes and sync speedups

item.title: Version 1.0.11
item.description:
• New filtering options for status items
  • Status item display disabled by default on new installs
  • First attempt at a preferences cleanup, more to come

item.title: Version 1.0.10
item.description: • Stability corrections for handling empty status item fields

item.title: Version 1.0.9
item.description:
• Support for GitHub statuses (alt-click to open them, and they can be disabled in preferences)
  • Will display a warning for PRs which are no longer mergeable
  • App will not announce user's own PRs
  • Faster refreshing, and stability corrections

item.title: Version 1.0.8
item.description:
• Menu closing behaviour corrected when removing items
  • New PRs won’t generate lists of comment notifications (regression)
  • Repo list now splits Repos into parent and forked repos
  • Mention auto-participation now also takes PR body text into account
  • Ability to display repositories and optionally include them when filtering
  • Option for simple grouping by repository
  • Ability to specify custom API server for the GitHub API (experimental)
  • Added more descriptive messaging for empty PR lists
  • Ability to hide “all PRs” section

item.title: Version 1.0.7
item.description:
• Important fix for null fields sent by Github API which could result in app crashing
  • Added options to skip confirming removing all merged/closed PRs
  • Preferences slightly cleaned up (though this needs more work)

item.title: Version 1.0.6
item.description: • Corrected an issue that would show a red menubar count when no PRs are showing any unread comments

item.title: Version 1.0.5
item.description: • Important fix for unread comment counts on items

item.title: Version 1.0.4
item.description:
• Added notification support for being mentioned in a Github comment
  • Added ability to move PRs in which you are mentioned to the "Participated" group
  • Added support to keeping closed (i.e. not merged) PRs much like the merged PRs are kept
  • Further code cleanup, hopefully even faster menu drawing and display issue corrections

item.title: Version 1.0.3
item.description:
• Corrected a filtering issue in 1.0.2, plus the changes from 1.0.2:
  • Corrected a non-critical issue with the “refreshing” menu item label
  • Significant UI smoothness and performance gains, specifically relating to image handling, caching, and comment counting logic
  • Large under-the-hood changes to improve the codebase
  • Improvements to API load warning logic
  • Repository refresh bug corrected
  • Prioritised API calls over image calls in the network queue
  • When removing merged PRs the menu re-opens after the confirmation box has been responded to
  • Failed database upgrades would cause the app to lock up, fixed
  • Corrected rare corner case where the first API load would fail and the app would give an API limit warning
